data.title: Extensions viewlet: Ability to uninstall extension using a keyboard shortcut

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #20440

1. Focus the list of installed extensions
2. Click on `delete` key - nothing happens. I would expect the extension to get uninstalled

data.title: Extensions viewlet: home / end strange behavior
data.body:
Refs: #20440 

1. Extensions viewlet, have the whole list of extensions with @sort:installs
2. Press `end` key - the very last elements gets focussed (there are like thousands)
3. Press up / down -> the bottom of the huge list gets revelaed
4. Press home -> the first element gets selected but does not get revelead

So there are two werid things here:
1. Home / end should reveal the element in the tree
2. End with an infinite list of items is weird and should be disabled

data.title: Find in folder should use root w/o selection
data.body:
testing #20438

* configure keybinding for "filesExplorer.findInFolder"
* selection files area but not a file
* trigger command, nothing happens, it should just fallback to searching inside the workspace

data.title: Search viewlet end key takes me to last file name, not last result
data.body:
Refs: #20440

1. Search viewlet, have some results
2. Focus on tree - press end key
3. The last file is focussed, not the last result
4. This is not aligned with the explorer where we always focus the last file, not the last folder

Note: this behavior is also present in the problems view.

data.title: Cannot read property 'init' of undefined when initializing git repo on an empty folder
data.body:
Testing #20999 (On Windows)

- Open VS Code on an empty folder (Also happening on non-empty folders)
- Go to SCM view
- Intiailize Git Repo

See following error

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/23208303/c82446b0-f8f4-11e6-8873-88d1abd2cb1d.png)

data.title: Clicking on file in scm viewlet automatically focuses that file
data.body:
Refs: #20440

1. SCM viewlet, have some changes
2. Click on any file in the scm viewlet
3. Focus is immediatly transfered to the editor
4. I would expect the SCM viewlet to behave like all out other viewlets (explorer, debug) - ony click preserves the focus in the viewlet. Only double click transfers focus. This way it is imposible to focus an item in the tree and then use keyboard for further navigation

data.title: Search viewlet: space not expanding / collapsing
data.body:
Refs: #20440 

1. Search viewlet, get some results
2. Navigate through tree -> press space on a file name -> I would expand it collapeses / expands the file. Instead there is no effect

data.title: Extensions viewlet: space to install extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs #20440

1. Extensions viewlet
2. Navigate through extensions using keyboard and press `space`
3. I would expect the space to install / uninstall extension as that would align nicely with the functionality `space` has in other trees

data.title: Toggling Zen mode flickers when running VS Code from Sources
data.body:
Testing #20327 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run VS Code from sources
2. Toggle Zen Mode 


![kapture 2017-02-22 at 11 35 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/23207855/0f646d72-f8f3-11e6-9b89-0a6f05eaa1b7.gif)

data.title: Allow file modification commands when focus is in opened editors view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
testing #20438

> filesExplorer.copy: copy a file from the files explorer
filesExplorer.paste: paste a file that was copied from the files explorer
filesExplorer.rename: rename a file/folder in files explorer
filesExplorer.moveFileToTrash: move a file/folder to trash from files explorer
filesExplorer.deleteFile: bypass trash and delete a file/folder from files explorer

I don't see a technical justification for above commands not to function for resources on disk that are showing in the open files section? It seems we are now building commands with very explicit names (`filesExplorer`) whereas a later bug fix/feature request could expand them to just work everywhere

data.title: Dragging text to start of line is confusing
data.body:
Testing #21012

- have a content like `100 200 300 400 500 600`
- select `600` and drag it to the beginning of the ine
- note that if drag too far left (over the line numbers), the drop affordace still shows, but dropping has no effect.

It would nice if dropping works also if the cursor is in the gutter area

data.title: Toggle full screen does not work while running VS Code out of sources
data.body:
Testing #20327 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run VS Code from source
2. Toggle Full screen -> Does not work

Same with Zen mode -> Does not go to full screen

data.title: Open editors: sections should not be collapsable
data.body:
Refs: #20440

1. Click in open editors view, have at least two editors side by side
2. Use keyboard to navigate to Left section
3. Arrow left colapses the section
4. This section should not be collapsable - notice how the mouse click has no effect

data.title: [scss] scss.lint.zeroUnits suggests removing required units
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set "scss.lint.zeroUnits": "warning" in settings.json
2. Create SCSS rule that uses time unit. E.g. transition-delay: 0s;
3. VS Code suggests that you can remove the time unit.

While unitless zero is allowed for 'length', it's invalid for all other units such as 'time' and 'angle'.

Note:
Angles might be due to a changes since the 11 June 2015 Candidate Recomendation:
"Allow zero angles to be represented as 0. (Change due to Web-compatibility constraints in transform and gradient syntaxes.)"

References:
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-values/
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-values/#changes
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/time#Examples
http://stackoverflow.com/a/13145406

data.title: Inconsistent naming of editor options
data.body: We have two new options `editor.minimap.enabled` and `editor.enableDragAndDrop`. Both talk about enabling a feature but use the word 'enable' is different ways. Also, we don't use 'enable' for other settings, like `editor.formatOnPaste` and not `editor.formatOnPaste.enabled` or `enableFormatOnPaste`

data.title: Welcome page: weird flow of installing keybindings
data.body:
Refs: #21034

OS X, insiders
1. Welcome page, click on sublime in keybindings
2. I get a notification about how a window will clickly reload
3. I click ok and no reload is happening, instead the keybinding is being installed and only after the installation a reload happens
4. This is much different than the usual extension install experience and I am not sure why are we differentiating here

I would expect that upon click on sublime we simply install the extension and open the extension viewlet. The extension will then have a reload button so a user can easily reload if he chooses. And not showing any message dialog at the top

![screen shot 2017-02-22 at 11 01 47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/23206545/522ac0f2-f8ee-11e6-985c-f74c37a07d96.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Welcome page: keybindings are already installed
data.body:
Refs #21034

os x, insiders, welcome page

1. Welcome page, install sublime keyboard shortcuts, reload vscode
2. Click on sublime keybindings - a message bar appears
3. We should try using the message service as little as possible as it is pesky to get rid of (user must click)
4. I propose that instead we open the extensions viewlet and show the list of installed extenssions - that will make it obvious to the user that he has sublime keybindings installed

data.title: [Feature request] Apply rename refactoring to all ES6 imports
data.body:
There a popular but unanswered question on stackoverflow: [Visual Studio Code - apply rename file refactoring in all ES6 imports](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37747938/visual-studio-code-apply-rename-file-refactoring-in-all-es6-imports/42387739#42387739)

> I've typescript application build with ES6 modules.
> 
> How do I rename ts or js file representing a module without breaking ES6 import that referenced the renamed file?
> 
> e.g: rename MyModule.ts to RenamedModule.ts -> change import * from './MyModule' to import * from  './RenamedModule' in all files;
> 
> Is there an VSCode extension or typescript service that would rename module path in all ES6 imports when renaming file?

I believe the VS Code users would appreciate this feature and that it belongs to VSCode

data.title: can't access marketplace behind proxy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (256d76fed7947e7289f921df10658d7a69233b65, 2017-02-22T07:10:23.895Z)

2.search extension
3.get message : Failed to load resource: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/_apis/public/gallery/extensionquery net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED
